channel.title: Failed to define domain. error: End of file while reading data: I/O error
channel.description:
I'm having a problem > :~$ sudo virsh -c qemu:///system define Whonix-Gateway*.xml > error: Disconnected from qemu:///system due to end of file > error: Failed to define domain from Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-16.0.3.7.xml > error: End of file while reading data: I/O error
Ubuntu 20.04 Reinstall host. Error remains. What could be? UDP /Kicksecure/msgcollector did not lead to positive results.

item.title: Failed to define domain. error: End of file while reading data: I/O error
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Gifochar:

The developers made it impossible for Russian-speaking users to use Whonix?

With absolute certainty:
No.
Whonix does not attempt to detect the user’s language. Let alone take action based on that.

Whatever issue you have is not due to hostile changes. No such thing.

Even if it was done (no, won’t happen), there would be a proper error message.

Gifochar:

is the distr Whonix safe?

How Secure is Whonix?

Read full topic
item.source: Failed to define domain. error: End of file while reading data: I/O error

item.title: Failed to define domain. error: End of file while reading data: I/O error
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Gifochar:

And on AMD A-8 Liano not working

KVM on AMD can be the issue, tried different operating systems in kvm over amd on the same machine?

Or as said before use debian as a host and test.

Gifochar:

The developers made it impossible for Russian-speaking users to use Whonix?

hm?!

Gifochar:

The question arises, and is the distr Whonix safe?

Based on what if its not safe?

Read full topic

item.title: Failed to define domain. error: End of file while reading data: I/O error
item.dc:creator: Gifochar
item.description:
I’m having a problem

:~$ sudo virsh -c qemu:///system define Whonix-Gateway*.xml
error: Disconnected from qemu:///system due to end of file
error: Failed to define domain from Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-16.0.3.7.xml
error: End of file while reading data: I/O error

Ubuntu 20.04
Reinstall host.
Error remains.
What could be?
UDP
/Kicksecure/msgcollector
did not lead to positive results.

Read full topic
